A county judge has reaffirmed his decision to allow the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company of New York to assume life insurance policies issued by subsidiaries of the bankrupt Baldwin-United Corporation. The Sun Life Guaranty Company of Arkansas had asked Judge Perry Whitmore of the Pulaski County Circuit Court to reconsider his decision. Metropolitan Life will be allowed to assume about 100,000 policies worth about $2 billion.
